intro: Elephantopus strigosus, commonly known as the hairy elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a cluster. Elephantopus strigosus is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
